properties.Notes: Border fault for the Zomba Graben.  All movement post Cretaceous Lower Chilwa Alkaline Province.  Southern sections mapped from aeromag where uncertainity on precise location of fault tip
properties.References: Bloomfield (1965); Wedmore et al (2020a); Kolawole et al (2021)

properties.Notes: Gentle scarp.  Southern end mapped from aeromag.
properties.References: Bloomfield and Garson (1965); Wedmore et al (2020a); Kolawole et al (2021)

properties.Notes: Closely spaced across strike from Thyolo,  possibly splay (?).

Termed the Chingombe Fault by Dawson and Kirkpatrick (1968). Juxtaposes charnockititc gneisses against recent sediments. Eastern tip of fault against syenite intrusion. Parallel to foliation in footwall.  Low certainity on whether fault still active.
High uncertainity on location, geometry,  and activity of fault.

properties.GeomorphEx: Escarpment, with distinct scarp at eastern edge of sub-aerial extent. Eastern tip of fault buried
properties.Notes: Karoo boundary fault,  juxtaposes basement gneisses and alluvium,  contains calcite and silicate fault rock.  Parallel to gneiss foliation.  Uncertainity on SE extent.

properties.GeomorphEx: Minor escaprment, buried at eastern end
properties.Notes: Mapped from minor escarpment with eastern extent of trace mapped from gravity survey,  and western extent from aeromagnetic
properties.References: Castaing (1991); Habgood (1963); Chisenga et al (2019); Kolawole et al (2021)

properties.Notes: Minor escarpment,  with different sections defined by fault bends.  Fault within Mozambique.

Near pure normal slip slickenslides.  Labelled Mpimbi fault by Bloomfield (1965). Southern and northern tips buried and mapped from aeromag.  Northern tip colocated with termal springs.  Uncertainity on southern extent,  mapped from aeromagnetic data
properties.References: Bloomfield (1965); Williams et al (2019); Wedmore et al (2020a); Kolawole et al (2021)

properties.GeomorphEx: Escarpment with disitnct scarp along some sections
properties.Notes: Eastern border fault for the Makanjira Graben.  Highly segmented fault system with variable exposure quality.
properties.References: Manyozo et al (1972); King and Dawson (1976); Dulanya et al (2017)

properties.Notes: Steep scarp at base of escarpment. Bounds Shire Horst and Lake Malombe.  Uncertainity on extent of southern tip
properties.References: Manyozo et al (1972); Hodge et al (2019); Kolawole et al (2021)

properties.Notes: Laterally continuous steep scarp suggests recent, possibly Late Quaternary,  events (Hodge et al 2020).
properties.References: Walshaw (1965); Dawson and Kirkpatrick (1968); Jackson and Blenkinsop (1997); Hodge et al (2018, 2019, 2020); Williams et al (2019)

properties.Notes: Northern extent of Urema Graben.

Part of larger Panga Fault System,  a Karoo age structure that juxtaposes Karoo sediments and lavas in the footwall against Cretaceous sediments and recent alluvium. Intruded and subsequently deforms dyke,  active pre and post Karoo.

Part of larger Panga Fault System,  a Karoo age structure that juxtaposes Karoo sediments and lavas in the footwall against Cretaceous sediments and recent alluvium. Intruded and subsequently deforms dyke,  active pre and post Karoo.

Part of larger Panga Fault System,  a Karoo age structure that juxtaposes Karoo sediments and lavas in the footwall against Cretaceous sediments and recent alluvium. Intruded and subsequently deforms dyke,  active pre and post Karoo.

Part of larger Panga Fault System,  a Karoo age structure that juxtaposes Karoo sediments and lavas in the footwall against Cretaceous sediments and recent alluvium. Intruded and subsequently deforms dyke,  active pre and post Karoo.
Fault does not follow foliation,  relatively prominent scarp 60 m high. No or very thin (<1 m) sediments in hanging wall on geological map,  confirmed by fieldwork.

properties.LocationM: Surface rupture mapping, Aeromag & Electical Resistivity Surveys
properties.Notes: Source of 2009 Karonga Earthquake Sequence. Consists of three sections, northern and central sections blind and mapped from aeromag
properties.References: Macheyeki et al. (2015); Kolawole et al (2018)

properties.Notes: Dip implies converges with South Karonga West at depth.
Dip implies converges at depth with Katseula.
Dip implies converges Lupaso fault system at depth.
Well defined escarpment.
properties.References: Kolawole et al. (2018), Dawson et al (2018); Ray (1975). The Geology of the Chitipa-Karonga area. Bulletin of the Geological Survey, Malawi, 42

properties.LocationM: SEGMeNT & Project PROBE 2D Seismic Reflection Data, TanDEM-X
properties.Notes: Prominent border fault for North Basin.  Segmented along strike. Describe in detail by Wheeler and Karson (1994) and Accardo et al (2018)
properties.References: Wheeler and Karson (1989), Wheeler and Rosendahl (1994); Mortimer et al (2007)

properties.Notes: Prominent scarp with swamps forming in hanging-wall due to footwall uplift
Footwall uplift diverts Kaombe Fault
Fault well exposed, but low confidence if still active
Forms small depocentre,  lateral extent very uncertain

properties.Notes: Prominent scarp with footwall uplift diverting the Bua river

properties.Notes: Forms minor escarpment in footwall of South Basin Fault 13
Dips imply converges with South Karonga East at depth.
Can be divided into three along-strike sections by bends.  Footwall uplift has resulted in lagoon forming in hanging-wall against scarp
Chonganga River cuts through footwall.  Indicative of slow slip rates?
Forms high displacment fault along the South Basin with South Basin Fault 13
Minor offset,  low confidence on lateral extent
Intersects with South Basin Fault 4 at depth?
Dips imply converges with South Basin Fault 3 at depth.

Segmented border fault for Lower Shire Basin.  Parallel to gneissic foliation. Previously mapped as seperate Thyolo and Muona faults (Hodge et al 2019). Includes buried section along Muona Fault.  Uncertainity on northern tip extent.
